text: The Lindi sharp-snouted worm lizard (Ancylocranium barkeri) is a worm lizard species in the family Amphisbaenidae. It is endemic to Tanzania. ==Etymology== The specific name, barkeri is in honor of New Zealander zoologist Ronald de la Bere Barker (1889–?).Beolens, Bo; Watkins, Michael; Grayson, Michael (2011). The Eponym Dictionary of Reptiles. Baltimore: Johns Hopkins University Press. xiii + 296 pp. . (Ancylcranium barkeri, p. 17). ==References== Category:Ancylocranium Category:Reptiles described in 1946 Category:Endemic fauna of Tanzania Category:Reptiles of Tanzania Category:Taxa named by Arthur Loveridge
title: Lindi sharp-snouted worm lizard
